00043 struct BMesh;
00044 struct ID;
00045 struct CustomData;
00046 struct CustomDataLayer;
00047 typedef uint64_t CustomDataMask;

00049 /*a data type large enough to hold 1 element from any customdata layer type*/
00050 typedef struct {unsigned char data[64];} CDBlockBytes;
00051 
00052 extern const CustomDataMask CD_MASK_BAREMESH;
00053 extern const CustomDataMask CD_MASK_MESH;
00054 extern const CustomDataMask CD_MASK_EDITMESH;

00057 extern const CustomDataMask CD_MASK_FACECORNERS;

00059 /* for ORIGINDEX layer type, indicates no original index for this element */
00060 #define ORIGINDEX_NONE -1
00061 
00062 /* initializes a CustomData object with the same layer setup as source and
00063  * memory space for totelem elements. mask must be an array of length
00064  * CD_NUMTYPES elements, that indicate if a layer can be copied. */
00065 
00066 /* add/copy/merge allocation types */
00067 #define CD_ASSIGN    0  /* use the data pointer */
00068 #define CD_CALLOC    1  /* allocate blank memory */
00069 #define CD_DEFAULT   2  /* allocate and set to default */
00070 #define CD_REFERENCE 3  /* use data pointers, set layer flag NOFREE */
00071 #define CD_DUPLICATE 4  /* do a full copy of all layers, only allowed if source
00072                          * has same number of elements */
00073 
00074 #define CD_TYPE_AS_MASK(_type) (CustomDataMask)((CustomDataMask)1 << (CustomDataMask)(_type))
00075 
00080 int CustomData_layer_has_math(struct CustomData *data, int layer_n);
00081 
00082 /* copies the "value" (e.g. mloopuv uv or mloopcol colors) from one block to
00083  * another, while not overwriting anything else (e.g. flags).  probably only
00084  * implemented for mloopuv/mloopcol, for now.*/
00085 void CustomData_data_copy_value(int type, void *source, void *dest);
00086 
00087 /* compares if data1 is equal to data2.  type is a valid CustomData type
00088  * enum (e.g. CD_MLOOPUV). the layer type's equal function is used to compare
00089  * the data, if it exists, otherwise memcmp is used.*/
00090 int CustomData_data_equals(int type, void *data1, void *data2);
00091 void CustomData_data_initminmax(int type, void *min, void *max);
00092 void CustomData_data_dominmax(int type, void *data, void *min, void *max);
00093 void CustomData_data_multiply(int type, void *data, float fac);
00094 void CustomData_data_add(int type, void *data1, void *data2);
00095 
00096 /* initializes a CustomData object with the same layer setup as source.
00097  * mask is a bitfield where (mask & (1 << (layer type))) indicates
00098  * if a layer should be copied or not. alloctype must be one of the above. */
00099 void CustomData_copy(const struct CustomData *source, struct CustomData *dest,
00100                      CustomDataMask mask, int alloctype, int totelem);
00101 
00102 /* BMESH_TODO, not really a public function but readfile.c needs it */
00103 void CustomData_update_typemap(struct CustomData *data);
00104 
00105 /* same as the above, except that this will preserve existing layers, and only
00106  * add the layers that were not there yet */
00107 void CustomData_merge(const struct CustomData *source, struct CustomData *dest,
00108                       CustomDataMask mask, int alloctype, int totelem);
00109 
00110 /* bmesh version of CustomData_merge; merges the layouts of source and dest,
00111  * then goes through the mesh and makes sure all the customdata blocks are
00112  * consistent with the new layout.*/
00113 void CustomData_bmesh_merge(struct CustomData *source, struct CustomData *dest, 
00114                             CustomDataMask mask, int alloctype, struct BMesh *bm, const char htype);
00115 
00116 /* frees data associated with a CustomData object (doesn't free the object
00117  * itself, though)
00118  */
00119 void CustomData_free(struct CustomData *data, int totelem);
00120 
00121 /* frees all layers with CD_FLAG_TEMPORARY */
00122 void CustomData_free_temporary(struct CustomData *data, int totelem);
00123 
00124 /* adds a data layer of the given type to the CustomData object, optionally
00125  * backed by an external data array. the different allocation types are
00126  * defined above. returns the data of the layer.
00127  *
00128  * in editmode, use EDBM_data_layer_add instead of this function
00129  */
00130 void *CustomData_add_layer(struct CustomData *data, int type, int alloctype,
00131                            void *layer, int totelem);
00132 /*same as above but accepts a name */
00133 void *CustomData_add_layer_named(struct CustomData *data, int type, int alloctype,
00134                            void *layer, int totelem, const char *name);
00135 
00136 /* frees the active or first data layer with the give type.
00137  * returns 1 on succes, 0 if no layer with the given type is found
00138  *
00139  * in editmode, use EDBM_data_layer_free instead of this function
00140  */
00141 int CustomData_free_layer(struct CustomData *data, int type, int totelem, int index);
00142 
00143 /* frees the layer index with the give type.
00144  * returns 1 on succes, 0 if no layer with the given type is found
00145  *
00146  * in editmode, use EDBM_data_layer_free instead of this function
00147  */
00148 int CustomData_free_layer_active(struct CustomData *data, int type, int totelem);
00149 
00150 /* same as above, but free all layers with type */
00151 void CustomData_free_layers(struct CustomData *data, int type, int totelem);
00152 
00153 /* returns 1 if a layer with the specified type exists */
00154 int CustomData_has_layer(const struct CustomData *data, int type);
00155 
00156 /* returns the number of layers with this type */
00157 int CustomData_number_of_layers(const struct CustomData *data, int type);
00158 
00159 /* duplicate data of a layer with flag NOFREE, and remove that flag.
00160  * returns the layer data */
00161 void *CustomData_duplicate_referenced_layer(struct CustomData *data, const int type, const int totelem);
00162 void *CustomData_duplicate_referenced_layer_named(struct CustomData *data,
00163                                                   const int type, const char *name, const int totelem);
00164 int CustomData_is_referenced_layer(struct CustomData *data, int type);
00165 
00166 /* set the CD_FLAG_NOCOPY flag in custom data layers where the mask is
00167  * zero for the layer type, so only layer types specified by the mask
00168  * will be copied
00169  */
00170 void CustomData_set_only_copy(const struct CustomData *data,
00171                               CustomDataMask mask);
00172 
00173 /* copies data from one CustomData object to another
00174  * objects need not be compatible, each source layer is copied to the
00175  * first dest layer of correct type (if there is none, the layer is skipped)
00176  * return 1 on success, 0 on failure
00177  */
00178 void CustomData_copy_data(const struct CustomData *source,
00179                           struct CustomData *dest, int source_index,
00180                           int dest_index, int count);
00181 void CustomData_copy_elements(int type, void *source, void *dest, int count);
00182 void CustomData_bmesh_copy_data(const struct CustomData *source, 
00183                                 struct CustomData *dest, void *src_block, 
00184                                 void **dest_block);
00185 
00186 /* frees data in a CustomData object
00187  * return 1 on success, 0 on failure
00188  */
00189 void CustomData_free_elem(struct CustomData *data, int index, int count);
00190 
00191 /* interpolates data from one CustomData object to another
00192  * objects need not be compatible, each source layer is interpolated to the
00193  * first dest layer of correct type (if there is none, the layer is skipped)
00194  * if weights == NULL or sub_weights == NULL, they default to all 1's
00195  *
00196  * src_indices gives the source elements to interpolate from
00197  * weights gives the weight for each source element
00198  * sub_weights is an array of matrices of weights for sub-elements (matrices
00199  *     should be source->subElems * source->subElems in size)
00200  * count gives the number of source elements to interpolate from
00201  * dest_index gives the dest element to write the interpolated value to
00202  *
00203  * returns 1 on success, 0 on failure
00204  */
00205 void CustomData_interp(const struct CustomData *source, struct CustomData *dest,
00206                        int *src_indices, float *weights, float *sub_weights,
00207                        int count, int dest_index);
00208 void CustomData_bmesh_interp(struct CustomData *data, void **src_blocks, 
00209                              float *weights, float *sub_weights, int count, 
00210                              void *dest_block);
00211 
00212 
00213 /* swaps the data in the element corners, to new corners with indices as
00214  * specified in corner_indices. for edges this is an array of length 2, for
00215  * faces an array of length 4 */
00216 void CustomData_swap(struct CustomData *data, int index, const int *corner_indices);
